document.docAuthor: Annunziata, Bruno B., Cavalcanti, Thaynã, Santos, George Garcia & Pinheiro, Ulisses
document.docTitle: Clathria (Axosuberites) hillenburgi Annunziata & Cavalcanti & Santos & Pinheiro 2019, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new Clathria (Axosuberites) Topsent, 1893 (Demospongiae: Poecilosclerida) from Northeastern Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new Clathria (Axosuberites) Topsent, 1893 (Demospongiae: Poecilosclerida) from Northeastern Brazil

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality:
Brazil , Paraíba State
,
Rio Tinto Municipality , Caracabu River , Mamanguape Estuary, Brazil
.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype :
UFPEPOR 1975, Caracabu River , Mamanguape Estuary ( 06°46’43.46’’S 34°55’55.61’’W ), Rio Tinto Municipality , Paraíba State , Brazil , intertidal (depth
0.5 m
), coll. T . Cavalcanti ,
11 November 2015
.

subSubSection.paragraph: External morphology ( Fig. 4A ). Arborescent sponge with filiform ramifications, cylindrical branches with 2 x 0.4 cm (length x width). Hispid surface, firm and compressible consistency. Oscula not observed. Red color when alive, and dark brown in 80% ethanol.

paragraph.tableNote:
References: (1) Samai & Gibbons (2005); (2)
Goodwin et al . (2012)
; (3) Lévi (1960) ; (4)
Van Soest et al . (2013)
; (5) Van Soest (2017) ; (6) Hooper (1996) ; (7) Bergquist & Fromont (1988) .

subSubSection.paragraph: Skeleton ( Fig. 4B ). Ectosome with brushes of small subtylostyles (styles II) overlapping the subectosomal spicules. Choanosomal skeleton composed of plumo-reticulate and compressed, extra-axial plumose tracts cored by (subtylo-)styles I. Plumose gaps near the surface. Subectosomal region composed by ascending plumose bundles of auxiliary subtylostyles arising from the peripheral choanosomal skeleton. Microscleres appear to be randomly distributed.

Spicules. Megascleres: (Subtylo-)styles I (270– 371.2 –447 / 6– 7.5 – 11 µm ): smooth to microspined, slightly curved, and rounded tyles, smooth to granular microspined tyles in some spicules ( Fig. 5A, D ); (Subtylo-)styles II (143– 179.8 –236 / 6– 8.1 – 10 µm ): smooth, slightly curved, and smooth, some styles II have microspined tyles ( Fig. 5B, F ); Subtylostyles (193– 307.6 –377 / 2– 2.5 – 3 µm ): smooth, slender, straight, microspined tyles ( Fig. 5C, E ); Microscleres: Palmate isochelae (12– 14.6 – 17 µm ): slightly curved axis and short alae ( Fig. 5G ); Toxas (24– 57.3 –96 / 1– 2.0 – 4 µm ): wing shaped, smooth, and slender ( Fig. 5H ).

Distribution and ecology. Known only from the type locality: Caracabu River/Estuary (Rio Tinto Municipality, Paraíba State , Brazil ), intertidal. Found in a mangrove area on roots of
Rhizophora
sp.
Etymology. The specific name is in honor to Stephen M. Hillenburg, marine biologist and creator of the cartoon character ‘SpongeBob SquarePants’.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4.
Clathria ( Axosuberites ) hillenburgi
n. sp.
(UFPEPOR 1975). A, preserved specimen; B, cross section showing the ectosome and choanosome. Scale bars: A = 2.5 cm; B = 500 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks.
Clathria ( Axosuberites ) hillenburgi
n. sp.
is characterized by a spicule arrangement with (subtylo-)styles I and II, auxiliary subtylostyles, toxa and palmate isochelae. The new species resembles to
Clathria
( A .) flabellata (Topsent, 1916)
and
Clathria
( A .) georgiaensis Hooper, 1996
(from the Antarctic Peninsula) by having two categories of styles and/or subtylostyles, toxas and palmate isochelae. However,
Clathria ( A .) hillenburgi
n. sp.
is distinguished from
Clathria
( A .) flabellata
and
Clathria
( A .) georgiaensis
due having shorter styles and toxas (see Table 1 ). Differences in megascleres categories among the new species and
Clathria
( A .) benguelaensis Samaai & Gibbons, 2005
,
Clathria
( A .) nidificata ( Kirkpatrick, 1907 )
include the number of megascleres categories (two in the new species and four in the others).
Clathria ( Axosuberites ) hillenburgi
n. sp.
distinguished from
Clathria
( A .) marplatensis ( Cuartas, 1992 )
,
Clathria
( A .) pachyaxia ( Lévi, 1960 )
,
Clathria
( A .) papillata Van Soest, Beglinger & De Voogd, 2013
,
Clathria
( A .) ramea ( Koltun, 1964 )
, and
Clathria
( A .) rosita Goodwin, Brewin & Brickle, 2012
by having two categories of styles and one of subtylostyle versus two categories of styles in the others. The new species differs from C.
( A .) aurantia
n. sp.
, C.
( A .) riosae Van Soest, 2017
and C.
( A .) papillata Van Soest, Beglinger & De Voogd, 2013
by the absence of toxas.
Clathria
( A .) canaliculata
and
C. ( A. ) cylindrica
have two categories of palmate isochelae, while the new species has only one category. Similarly,
C. ( A. ) fromontae
,
C. ( A. ) macrotoxa
,
C. ( A. ) multitoxaformis
and
C. ( A. ) thetidis
have two size categories of toxas, while
C. ( Axosuberites ) hillenburgi
n. sp.
has only one category. Finally, the new species is distinguished from
Clathria ( A. ) patula ( Hooper, 1996 )
by having three categories of styles.
